item.title: Moon Stock Plummets After Odysseus Lunar Lander Tips Over. NASA Calls Landing a Success.
item.description: Intuitive Machines provided an update on its Odysseus lunar lander on Friday evening. Its moon landing was quite an achievement, but not everything went according to plan.

item.title: Berkshire’s Operating Profits Rose 28% in Fourth Quarter. Cash Hit a Record $167 Billion.
Warren Buffett’s Annual Letter: Berkshire Won’t Buy Occidental
item.description: Berkshire Hathaway’s CEO also highlighted the challenges of the company’s railroad, utility businesses.

item.title: Palo Alto Networks Is Making a Bold But Risky Bet to Dominate Cybersecurity
item.description: Palo Alto Networks shares plunged 28%, vaporizing almost $34 billion in market value after it revealed its new strategy.

item.title: What’s Behind the S&P 500’s Spectacular Gains, in 4 Charts
item.description: Nvidia stock is up 59% so far in 2024. It tripled in 2023.

item.title: Whether Trump or Biden Wins, the Election Won’t Matter For the Market
item.description: Elections aren’t predictive of market returns. Focus on the economy, Fed policy, and earnings.

item.title: M&A Has Been Downhill Since 2021. Recent Deals Stir Hope of a Revival.
item.description: It has been a decent start of the year for major transactions, capped by the biggest so far, Capital One’s proposed $35 billion deal for Discover. But it requires more than a few splashy deals to ignite a sustainable wave of M&A.

item.title: Super Micro Computer Can Raise Money for Free. It’s Bad News for Interest Rates.
item.description: J.P. Morgan strategists estimate future returns from U.S. stocks will average about 6% over the next decade, well below the 10.8% average return of the past 35 years.

item.title: Nvidia Passes $2 Trillion Valuation in Intraday Trading. How Its Rise Compares With Apple and Microsoft.
item.description: The chip maker is set to be only the third U.S. company ever to close with a valuation of more than $2 trillion.

item.title: Nvidia Is King of the Mag 7. It’s Not Even Close.
item.description: Nvidia’s latest results show it’s in a different league than Microsoft, Amazon, and the rest of Big Tech.

item.title: Nvidia, Carvana, Block, Booking, Intuitive Machines, Warner Bros., Rivian, and More Stock Market Movers
item.description: Nvidia’s valuation briefly surpassed $2 trillion during Friday’s session, Carvana rallied on upbeat sales guidance, and Block’s quarterly gross profit jumped 22%.

item.title: 3 Things From a Wild Week of Stock Trading, With a Look Ahead
item.description: The S&P 500 is on pace for a solid gain this week, thanks in no small part to Nvidia.

item.title: Booking Drops After Earnings. Moderating Travel Is No Surprise for CEO.
item.description: The travel website’s earnings ticked all the boxes—an earnings beat, record-breaking annual results, and a dividend initiation. But there was a catch.

item.title: Rivian Stock Gets a Rare Double Downgrade. EV Demand Is a Problem.
item.description: UBS analyst Joe Spak downgrades shares of Rivian to Sell from Buy and cuts his price target to $8 a share from $24.

item.title: Amazon Joins the Dow Club. It Could Pay a Price.
item.description: Since the late 1970s, new Dow 30 stocks have struggled in the year after joining. Amazon, a Magnificent Seven stock, has a formidable retail business, and is fueled by its cloud computing business. But the history is the history.

item.title: This Rally Is Much Bigger Than Nvidia and Big Tech.
item.description: This stock market rally has persisted despite the fact that its original justification—multiple rate cuts—has fallen apart. Economic indicators have held up well, with or without AI.

item.title: Why More European Firms Are Hopping the Pond to List in the U.S.
item.description: Foreign companies are attracted by the bigger market, stronger stock prices and more rapidly growing economy in the U.S.

item.title: The Wilshire 5000 Was the First Total Market Stock Index. At 50, It Has Gone Global.
item.description: The index celebrates its golden anniversary this year. Its history tells us a lot about how financial markets and investing have changed.

item.title: AT&T Says Outage Caused by Software Update, Not Cyberattack
item.description: Thousands of customers on Thursday reported problems making and receiving phone calls.

item.title: America’s Housing Crisis Has Been Years in the Making. Why It’s Taking So Long to Fix.
item.description: James McMillan III, better known as the founder of The Rent is Too Damn High Party, is more right than ever.
